title: Chema Mato
text:
José Maria 'Chema' Mato Nieto (born 22 March 1984) is a Spanish <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="CD%20Bezana">CD Bezana</a> as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Santander%2C%20Spain">Santander</a>, <a href="Cantabria">Cantabria</a>, Mato made his senior debuts with <a href="Deportivo%20Rayo%20Cantabria">Deportivo Rayo Cantabria</a> in the 2003–04 season, in <a href="Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Tercera División</a>. A season later, he joined <a href="Racing%20de%20Santander">Racing de Santander</a>, being assigned to <a href="Racing%20de%20Santander%20B">the reserves</a> also in the fourth level. He also appeared two times with the first team (against <a href="Real%20Madrid%20C.F.">Real Madrid</a> on 21 December 2005 and against <a href="Real%20Betis">Real Betis</a> on 17 June 2007), only limited to the bench, however.
On 17 August 2007 Mato signed with <a href="Racing%20de%20Ferrol">Racing de Ferrol</a>, in <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a>. He made his division debut on 2 September, starting in a 3–1 away win over <a href="Polideportivo%20Ejido">Polideportivo Ejido</a>. Mato scored his first professional goal on 5 April 2008, the first of a 2–1 home win over <a href="Celta%20de%20Vigo">Celta de Vigo</a>.
Mato played in <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">Segunda División B</a> but also in the fourth level in the following seasons, representing <a href="Cultural%20y%20Deportiva%20Leonesa">Cultural y Deportiva Leonesa</a>, Rayo Cantabria, <a href="CF%20Villanovense">CF Villanovense</a>, <a href="Real%20Balomp%C3%A9dica%20Linense">Real Balompédica Linense</a>, <a href="CD%20Guadalajara%20%28Spain%29">CD Guadalajara</a> and <a href="CD%20Tudelano">CD Tudelano</a>.
